summary.para: A ColorCurveParams structure contains members that specify an adjustment to the colors of a bitmap.

The ColorCurve class encompasses eight separate adjustments: exposure, density, contrast, highlight, shadow, midtone, white saturation, and black saturation. You can apply one of those adjustments to a bitmap by following these steps.

item.description: Create and initialize a ColorCurveParams structure.
Pass the address of the ColorCurveParams structure to the method of a ColorCurve object.
Pass the address of the ColorCurve object to the Graphics.DrawImage method or to the method.

member.name: ColorCurveParams.adjustment
member.summary: Element of the enumeration that specifies the adjustment to be applied.

member.name: ColorCurveParams.channel
member.summary: Element of the enumeration that specifies the color channel to which the adjustment applies.

member.name: ColorCurveParams.adjustValue
member.summary: Integer that specifies the intensity of the adjustment. The range of acceptable values depends on which adjustment is being applied. To see the range of acceptable values for a particular adjustment, see the enumeration.
